description.plain: Kream, is a Norwegian DJ duo consisting of brothers Daniel and Markus Slettebakken, from Bergen.

body.plain: Kream, is a Norwegian DJ duo consisting of brothers Daniel and Markus Slettebakken, from Bergen.

songs.full_title: Taped Up Heart by KREAM (Ft. Clara Mae)
songs.title: Taped Up Heart

description.plain:
Norwegian duo KREAM enlist Swedish singer Clara Mae for the harrowing “Taped Up Heart.” Over a sunny trop-house backing, Mae weathers an emotional superstorm. Clara Mae is perhaps best known for her three-year stint—from 2009 to 2012—in Swedish pop foursome Ace of Base.  KREAM said of this song in a press release:

We like getting to explore darker concepts while still keeping the track upbeat. Clara was the perfect fit for this one. So good to share “Taped Up Heart” with everyone today.

songs.embed_content: Read “Taped Up Heart” by KREAM on Genius

body.plain:
Norwegian duo KREAM enlist Swedish singer Clara Mae for the harrowing “Taped Up Heart.” Over a sunny trop-house backing, Mae weathers an emotional superstorm. Clara Mae is perhaps best known for her three-year stint—from 2009 to 2012—in Swedish pop foursome Ace of Base.  KREAM said of this song in a press release:

We like getting to explore darker concepts while still keeping the track upbeat. Clara was the perfect fit for this one. So good to share “Taped Up Heart” with everyone today.

songs.lyrics:
17 ContributorsTaped Up Heart Lyrics[Verse 1: Clara Hagman]
There is no place I can hide
Cause wherever I go it's you I find
I got a can of bright blue pills
Supposed to get rid of them heavy feels, yeah

[Verse 2: Clara Hagman]
I bet that she's beautiful and there is no doubt
She's all that you wanted, the queen of the crowd
I bet your friends love her, cause she's always so fun, yeah
And the worst thing of all is I used to be that one

[Chorus: Clara Hagman]
Now it's only just me and my sheets
Got your hands on me on repeat
All I wanna do is go to sleep
With my taped up heart and my open bottle
Me and my sheets
You should know that we're done with your shit
All I wanna do is go to sleep
With my taped up heart and my open bottle

[Bassline: Kream]
Hold up

[Chorus: Clara Hagman]
Now it's only just me and my sheets
Got your hands on me on repeat
All I wanna do is go to sleep
With my taped up heart and my open bottle
Me and my sheets
You should know that we're done with your shit
All I wanna do is go to sleep
With my taped up heart and my open bottle
You might also like[Bridge]
When I fall, I fall deeper, yeah, I'm still falling
Can't get rid of the feeling, the feeling haunt me
So I fall, I fall deeper, deeper, deeper
So I fall, I fall deeper, deeper, deeper

[Chorus: Clara Hagman]
Now it's only just me and my sheets
Got your hands on me on repeat
All I wanna do is go to sleep
With my taped up heart and my open bottle
Me and my sheets
You should know that we're done with your shit
All I wanna do is go to sleep
With my taped up heart and my open bottle

[Bassline: Kream]
Hold up

[Chorus: Clara Hagman]
Now it's only just me and my sheets
Got your hands on me on repeat
All I wanna do is go to sleep
With my taped up heart and my open bottle
Me and my sheets
You should know that we're done with your shit
All I wanna do is go to sleep
With my taped up heart and my open bottle
[Bassline: Kream]4Embed

songs.title: Drowning

description.plain: “Drowning” was released on July 21, 2017, and is the second song where KREAM, the brother duo from Bergen, Sweden, collaborated with the vocalist Clara Mae on a dance pop track. Previously KREAM and Clara Mae also worked together on the hit “Taped Up Heart.”

songs.embed_content: Read “Drowning” by KREAM on Genius

songs.lyrics:
4 ContributorsDrowning Lyrics[Verse 1]
We found our hearts on lockdown
You faded in the background
Any other day I'd dry my tears away
I'd keep it all inside my heavy mind

Living in the desert of us
While the city go, city go wild
And I know you'd kill for a drop
Always waiting for rain

We're drowning out

Yeah

songs.title: Deep End

description.plain:
KREAM says,

“Deep End was born in LA during a writing session where we discussed the idea of asking for help. It’s not always easy, but sometimes you need that support from the people around you to get through the darkness. We collaborated with Slime Sunday once again, creating a new art direction that focuses on fluidity and form.”

songs.embed_content: Read “Deep End” by KREAM on Genius

5 ContributorsDeep End Lyrics[Verse 1]
How long, how long
How long has it been since we talked?
How long, how long
